exercises.name: Leg Swings (Front/Back & Side)
exercises.note: Anchor yourself: Hold onto a wall or fence post. This is a mobility drill, not a balance test. • Don't arch: Keep your core slightly braced. When swinging back, avoid arching your lower back. • Soft Knee: Keep a slight bend in the standing leg.

exercises.name: Hip Circles (Standing Hip CARs)
exercises.note: Isolate the Joint: Imagine your upper body is a statue. Only the hip should move. • The 'Hurdle': Visualize stepping up and over a high hurdle. • Slow Down: Movement should be slow and controlled.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges + Twist
exercises.note: Twist Toward the Knee: Always twist toward the front leg to lock hips and force thoracic rotation. • Vertical Shin: Don't let the front knee cave inward. • Hips Square: Keep hip bones pointing straight ahead; only shoulders rotate.

exercises.name: Lateral Lunges
exercises.note: Sit Back: Push hips back like sitting in a chair. • Keep heels down: Heel of bending leg stays glued to ground. • Trailing Leg: Non-working leg must remain perfectly straight. You should feel a stretch in the inner thigh.

exercises.name: Arm Circles & Trunk Rotations
exercises.note: Arm Circles: Focus on reaching out to expand the chest. • Trunk Rotations: Rotate upper body while keeping hips completely still. This 'dissociation' is vital for independent aids.

exercises.name: COOL: Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.note: The 'Anti-Arch': Kneel on one knee. Stay upright and tuck pelvis under (posterior tilt). • Glute Activation: Squeeze the glute of the kneeling leg hard to feel a deep stretch in front of the hip.

exercises.name: COOL: Adductor Stretch
exercises.note: Stance: Wide stance. Shift weight to one side, keeping other leg straight. • Torso Lean: Slight forward lean is okay if back is flat. • Hold: Relax into the stretch to release tension from gripping the saddle.

exercises.name: COOL: Figure-4 Glute Stretch
exercises.note: Lying Down: Cross ankle over opposite knee. • Pull In: Gently pull thigh toward chest. • Relax: Keep head and shoulders on ground. Use a towel if needed so neck stays relaxed.

exercises.name: COOL: Calf Stretch
exercises.note: Wall Push: Step one foot back. • Lock the Heel: Keep back heel touching ground. • Two Angles: Do 15s with straight leg (Gastrocnemius) and 15s with bent leg (Soleus).

exercises.name: COOL: Chest Opener
exercises.note: Doorway: Forearm against frame at 90 degrees. • Step: Step through until stretch felt across chest. • Don't Rotate: Keep chest square to front; don't just twist away.

exercises.name: COOL: Cat-Cow Release
exercises.note: Motion Wave: Move one vertebra at a time. • Cat: Push ground away, tuck chin/tailbone. • Cow: Lift tailbone, drop belly, squeeze shoulder blades.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.note: The Hold: Cup weight against sternum. Forces core engagement and upright posture. • Depth Check: Elbows touch inside of knees. • Foot Pressure: Even tripod foot. Don't let heels lift.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.note: The Hinge: Push hips back horizontally (close car door with butt). • Knee Position: Unlock knees then freeze them. If they bend more, it becomes a squat. • Lat Engagement: Squeeze armpits tight to protect back.

exercises.name: Lateral Lunge
exercises.note: Hips Back: Step out and immediately push hips back. • The Anchor: Non-working leg remains straight. Feel stretch in inner thigh. • Torso: Keep chest up ('show the logo').

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Bent-Knee)
exercises.note: Setup: Top knee on bench. Bottom leg off ground. • Adductor Focus: Drive top knee down to lift body. Targets inner thighs used to grip saddle. • Straight Line: Don't let hips sag.

exercises.name: Back Extension (Supermans)
exercises.note: Reach: Reach fingertips and toes to opposite walls. Length creates tension. • Glute Squeeze: Squeeze glutes before lifting. • Neck Alignment: Gaze on floor to protect neck.

exercises.name: Bird-Dog
exercises.note: The Tray: Imagine a tray of drinks on your lower back. Don't tip it. • Opposites: Extend arm/leg simultaneously. • Rider Relevance: Trains diagonal stability (like the trot).

exercises.name: Dumbbell One-arm Row
exercises.note: Pull Angle: Pull dumbbell back toward hip pocket to engage lats. • Anti-Rotation: Keep shoulders square to ground. • Support: Press non-working hand firmly into bench.

exercises.name: Incline Push-ups
exercises.note: Body Line: Rigid plank from head to heel. • Elbow Angle: Tuck elbows back at 45 degrees (Arrow shape), not flared (T shape). • Incline: Prioritize perfect form over getting closer to floor.

exercises.name: 90/90 Hip Stretch & Activation
exercises.note: Setup: Legs bent at 90 degrees (front and side). • Stretch: Lean torso forward with flat back. • Activation: Drive knees/shins into floor for 5-10s to build strength at end range.

exercises.name: Ankle Dorsiflexion Rocks
exercises.note: Goal: Increase range for 'heels down' position. • The Rock: Push knee forward over toes without heel lifting. • Alignment: Knee tracks over middle/outside toes.

exercises.name: Trap Bar / KB Deadlift
exercises.note: Setup: Start from floor. • Squat vs Hinge: Hips lower than RDL, chest more upright. • Shin Angle: Shins can travel forward. • Lat Tension: Rotate elbows back to engage lats before lifting.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.note: Stance Width: Step back on 'railroad tracks' for balance. • Weight Distribution: 70% weight in front heel. • Torso Lean: Slight forward lean mimics two-point position.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Hold)
exercises.note: Progression: Try with ankle on bench (straight leg). • Static Hold: Isometric hold trains adductors to stabilize pelvis. • No Sagging: Keep hips lifted high.

exercises.name: Swiss Ball Hamstring Curls
exercises.note: Bridge First: Lift hips before curling. • The Curl: Drag ball toward glutes. Keep straight line from shoulder to knee at top. • Instability: Fight the wobble to activate stabilizers.

exercises.name: Plank with Shoulder Taps
exercises.note: The Goal: Do not move hips. Imagine a glass of water on your lower back. • Foot Position: Wide feet = easier balance. • Anti-Rotation: Trains core to resist twisting forces.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.note: Grip: Palms facing each other. • The Pull: Pull rope to bridge of nose. Hands back, elbows out. • End Position: Double bicep pose. Squeeze blades. Antidote to rounded shoulders.

exercises.name: Back Squat
exercises.note: Create the Shelf: Rest bar on traps, not neck. • The Descent: Unlock hips/knees together. Spread floor with feet. • Rider Relevance: Mimics heavy landing absorption.

exercises.name: Single-Leg RDL
exercises.note: Square Hips: Don't let lifting hip rotate up. • Soft Knee: Micro-bend in standing leg. • Teeter-Totter: Torso and back leg move as one unit.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Motion)
exercises.note: The Movement: Lower bottom hip toward floor, drive back up. • Adductor Focus: Drive upward by pressing top inner thigh into bench.

exercises.name: Box / Squat Jumps
exercises.note: The Landing: Land quietly with hips back. No loud thuds. • Step Down: Jump up, step down. • Arm Swing: Use arms to generate momentum.

exercises.name: Swiss Ball Plank
exercises.note: Instability: Ball will shake; stop it. • Shoulder Position: Push elbows into ball (protraction). • Anti-Extension: Don't let lower back sag.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Reverse Fly
exercises.note: Torso Angle: Hinge until nearly parallel. Flat back. • The Squeeze: Pinch a pencil between shoulder blades at top. • Control: Lower slowly.

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift
exercises.note: Slack: Pull up until you hear 'clink' before lifting. • Leg Drive: Push floor away. • Lockout: Stand tall, squeeze glutes. Don't hyperextend.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.note: Setup: Sit on bench, extend leg, stand up. • Torso Angle: Upright for quad/hip stretch, lean forward for glute. • Grind: Slow controlled reps.

exercises.name: Skater Hops (Lateral Bound)
exercises.note: Lateral Power: Push off outside edge. Cover distance sideways. • The Stick: Land and freeze for 1s. • Back Leg: Can swing behind but try not to touch ground.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Adv. Hold)
exercises.note: Progression: Top leg straight, ankle on bench. Increases lever arm. • Alignment: Straight line ear to ankle. • Breathing: Shallow breaths into ribs, keep abs braced.

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.note: The Press: Press handle straight out. Don't let weight twist you. • Core: Further hands are from body = harder work. Hold 1-2s.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.note: Full Stretch: Let shoulders roll forward at start. • The Pull: Retract blades, drive elbows back. • No Momentum: Keep torso stationary.

exercises.name: DB Bench Press
exercises.note: 45-Degree Angle: Tuck elbows (Arrow shape). • Stability: Plant feet firmly. • Dumbbells: Stabilize hands independently to fix imbalances.

exercises.name: Split Squat Jumps
exercises.note: The Scissor: Jump up, switch legs mid-air. • Cushion Landing: Absorb impact immediately. No loud thumps. • Torso Control: Keep chest up.

exercises.name: KB Swings
exercises.note: Hinge Not Squat: Knees bend slightly. • The Float: Arms are ropes; hip power lifts the bell. • Top Position: Tall plank. Squeeze glutes/abs. Don't lean back.

exercises.name: Depth Drops to Jump
exercises.note: Gravity works: Step off box. • Reactive Power: Explode up immediately upon touching ground. • Knees: Prevent inward cave (valgus).

exercises.name: Copenhagen (Maintenance)
exercises.note: Maintenance Mode: Hold strength without blowing out muscles. • Regulate: Regress to knee placement if needed. Focus on activation.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-Up
exercises.note: Eye Contact: Look at weight until standing. • Steps: Roll to elbow -> Hand -> Bridge -> Sweep leg -> Windmill up -> Stand. • Shoulder Packing: Keep shoulder down.

exercises.name: Farmers Carry
exercises.note: Posture: String pulling head to sky. • Rib Cage: Keep ribs tucked. • Gait: Short, choppy steps. No waddling.

exercises.name: Swiss Ball Plank
exercises.note: Stir the Pot: Optional circles with elbows. • Glute Lock: Squeeze glutes to stabilize pelvis. • Neck: Neutral gaze at hands.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat Half Hold
exercises.note: The Position: Hold at half squat (parallel). • The Burn: Isometric fatigue. • Mental Focus: Keep chest up and elbows off knees.
